PredicateCore.js

  1. /* eslint no-unused-vars: "off" */
  3. /**
  4.  * PredicateCore
  5.  * @module core
  6.  * @namespace core
  7.  * @since 1.0.0
  8.  * @note rules are 100% tested from PredicateCore.test.js
  9.  */
  11. const {
  12.   merge,
  13.   find,
  14.   curry,
  15.   pipe,
  16.   filter,
  17.   map,
  18.   takeLast,
  19.   insert,
  20. } = require('ramda');
  22. const option = require('option');
  24. const { EventEmitter } = require('events');
  26. function head(list) {
  27.   return option.fromNullable(list[0]).value();
  28. }
  30. module.exports = function({ dataclasses, invariants, errors, rules, UITypes }) {
  31.   const { CompoundPredicate, ComparisonPredicate, Predicate } = dataclasses;
  32.   /**
  33.    * Get a type by its type_id
  34.    * @param  {array} types types
  35.    * @param  {string} type_id   type id name
  36.    * @return {?dataclasses.Type}  a Type
  37.    * @private
  38.    * @since 1.0.0
  39.    */
  40.   const _getTypeById = (types, type_id) =>
  41.     option.fromNullable(find(type => type.type_id === type_id, types));
  43.   /**
  44.    * Get a target by its target_id
  45.    * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Target>} targets targets
  46.    * @param  {string} target_id target id name
  47.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Target, errors.Target_idMustReferToADefinedTarget>}  resolved promise will yield a Target, rejected promise will yield `Target_idMustReferToADefinedTarget` if target_id was not found in `targets`
  48.    * @private
  49.    * @since 1.0.0
  50.    */
  51.   const _getTargetById = (targets, target_id) =>
  52.     invariants.Target_idMustReferToADefinedTarget(
  53.       find(target => target.target_id === target_id, targets)
  54.     );
  56.   /**
  57.    * Get a logical type by its logicalType_id
  58.    * @param  {Array<dataclasses.LogicalType>} logicalTypes logicalTypes
  59.    * @param  {string} logicalType_id logicalType id name
  60.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.LogicalType, errors.LogicalType_idMustReferToADefinedLogicalType>} resolved promise will yield a LogicalType, rejected promise will yield `LogicalType_idMustReferToADefinedLogicalType` if logicalType was not found in `logicalTypes`.
  61.    * @private
  62.    * @since 1.0.0
  63.    */
  64.   const _getLogicalTypeById = (logicalTypes, logicalType_id) =>
  65.     invariants.LogicalType_idMustReferToADefinedLogicalType(
  66.       find(
  67.         logicalType => logicalType.logicalType_id === logicalType_id,
  68.         logicalTypes
  69.       )
  70.     );
  72.   /**
  73.    * Get an operator by its operator_id
  74.    * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Operator>} operators operators
  75.    * @param  {string[]} operator_id operator_id
  76.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Operator, errors.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator>} resolved promise will yield an Operator, rejected promise will yield `Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator` if operator was not found in `operators`.
  77.    * @private
  78.    * @since 1.0.0
  79.    */
  80.   const _getOperatorById = (operators, operator_id) =>
  81.     invariants.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator(
  82.       find(operator => operator.operator_id === operator_id, operators)
  83.     );
  85.   /**
  86.    * _getOperatorsByIds
  87.    * @param  {Object} operators operators
  88.    * @param  {string[]} operator_ids operator_ids
  89.    * @return {Array<dataclasses.operator>}
  90.    * @private
  91.    * @since 1.0.0
  92.    */
  93.   const _getOperatorsByIds = curry((operators, operator_ids) =>
  94.     pipe(filter(({ operator_id }) => operator_ids.includes(operator_id)))(
  95.       operators
  96.     )
  97.   );
  99.   const _set$operatorsToType = curry((columns, type) => {
  100.     type.$operators = _getOperatorsByIds(columns.operators, type.operator_ids);
  101.     return type;
  102.   });
  104.   const _set$typeToTarget = curry((columns, target) => {
  105.     const typeOption = _getTypeById(columns.types, target.type_id);
  106.     return invariants
  107.       .TargetMustReferToADefinedType(typeOption, target)
  108.       .then(type => {
  109.         target.$type = type;
  110.         return target;
  111.       });
  112.   });
  114.   /**
  115.    * Tap for Promise
  116.    * @param  {Function} f function to call
  117.    * @return {Function} function that accept a promise and will call `f`
  118.    * @private
  119.    */
  120.   const _tapPromise = f => {
  121.     return function(promise) {
  122.       return promise.then(result => {
  123.         f();
  124.         return result;
  125.       });
  126.     };
  127.   };
  129.   /**
  130.    * Run `fAfter()` (without any arguments) after `fBefore`, it will yield the promise yield from fBefore
  131.    * @param  {Function} fBefore fBefore
  132.    * @param  {Function} fAfter fAfter
  133.    * @return {Promise} promise from fBefore
  134.    * @private
  135.    */
  136.   const _afterPromise = (fBefore, fAfter) => pipe(fBefore, _tapPromise(fAfter));
  138.   // columns => Promise[columns]
  139.   const _initializeColumns = columns => {
  140.     // at first I used lenses, but the code was way harder to read so it's better that way :)
  142.     // wrap operators
  143.     columns.operators = map(dataclasses.Operator, columns.operators);
  145.     // wrap logicalTypes
  146.     columns.logicalTypes = map(dataclasses.LogicalType, columns.logicalTypes);
  148.     // wrap argumentTypes (allow argumentTypes to be undefined)
  149.     columns.argumentTypes = map(
  150.       dataclasses.ArgumentType,
  151.       columns.argumentTypes || []
  152.     );
  154.     // wrap types and set `$operators` attribute on each type
  155.     const wrapType = pipe(dataclasses.Type, _set$operatorsToType(columns));
  156.     columns.types = map(wrapType, columns.types);
  158.     // wrap targets and set `$type` attribut on each target
  159.     const wrapTarget = pipe(dataclasses.Target, _set$typeToTarget(columns));
  160.     return Promise.all(map(wrapTarget, columns.targets)).then(targets => {
  161.       columns.targets = targets;
  162.       return columns;
  163.     });
  164.   };
  166.   /**
  167.    * Create a new PredicateCore
  168.    * @param       {Object} args Predicate Core parameters
  169.    * @param       {?dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} [args.data=core.defaults.options.getDefaultData] data
  170.    * @param       {Object} [args.columns] columns definition
  171.    * @example <caption>Example of columns definition</caption>
  172.    * // don't forget to take a look at the Storybook https://ui-predicate.fgribreau.com/ui-predicate-vue/latest#/examples
  173.    * {
  174.    * // first define the operator list available along with what type of argument they need
  175.    * operators: [
  176.    *   {
  177.    *     operator_id: 'is',
  178.    *     label: 'is',
  179.    *     argumentType_id: 'smallString',
  180.    *   },
  181.    *   {
  182.    *     operator_id: 'contains',
  183.    *     label: 'Contains',
  184.    *     argumentType_id: 'smallString',
  185.    *   },
  186.    *   {
  187.    *     operator_id: 'isLowerThan',
  188.    *     label: '<',
  189.    *     argumentType_id: 'number',
  190.    *   },
  191.    *   {
  192.    *     operator_id: 'isEqualTo',
  193.    *     label: '=',
  194.    *     argumentType_id: 'number',
  195.    *   },
  196.    *   {
  197.    *     operator_id: 'isHigherThan',
  198.    *     label: '>',
  199.    *     argumentType_id: 'number',
  200.    *   },
  201.    *   {
  202.    *     operator_id: 'is_date',
  203.    *     label: 'is',
  204.    *     argumentType_id: 'datepicker',
  205.    *   },
  206.    *   {
  207.    *     operator_id: 'isBetween_date',
  208.    *     label: 'is between',
  209.    *     argumentType_id: 'daterangepicker',
  210.    *   },
  211.    * ],
  212.    * // then define the type, think of them as aggregate of operators so you can attach them to targets
  213.    * types: [
  214.    *   {
  215.    *     type_id: 'int',
  216.    *     operator_ids: ['isLowerThan', 'isEqualTo', 'isHigherThan'],
  217.    *   },
  218.    *   {
  219.    *     type_id: 'string',
  220.    *     operator_ids: ['is', 'contains'],
  221.    *   },
  222.    *   {
  223.    *     type_id: 'datetime',
  224.    *     operator_ids: ['is', 'isBetween'],
  225.    *   },
  226.    * ],
  227.    * // finally define targets, don't forget to specify their associated `type_id`
  228.    * targets: [
  229.    *   {
  230.    *     target_id: 'title',
  231.    *     label: 'Title',
  232.    *     type_id: 'string',
  233.    *   },
  234.    *   {
  235.    *     target_id: 'videoCount',
  236.    *     label: 'Video count',
  237.    *     type_id: 'int',
  238.    *   },
  239.    *   {
  240.    *     target_id: 'publishedAt',
  241.    *     label: 'Created at',
  242.    *     type_id: 'datetime',
  243.    *   },
  244.    * ],
  245.    * // define supported logical type
  246.    * logicalTypes: [
  247.    *   {
  248.    *     logicalType_id: 'any',
  249.    *     label: 'Any',
  250.    *   },
  251.    *   {
  252.    *     logicalType_id: 'all',
  253.    *     label: 'All',
  254.    *   },
  255.    *   {
  256.    *     logicalType_id: 'none',
  257.    *     label: 'None',
  258.    *   },
  259.    * ],
  260.    * // (optional) finally define how to display each argumentType_id
  261.    * argumentTypes: [
  262.    *   // here we don't define `component` because it depends on the UI Framework you are using (e.g. Vue, React, Angular, ...)
  263.    *   // since we are in ui-predicate-core here we don't know the UI Framework library that will be used
  264.    *   // read your UI Framework adapter (e.g. ui-predicate-vue) on how to set the component.
  265.    *   // if no argumentType is defined for argumentType_id, then UIPredicateCore will fallback on the default UI component (thanks to getDefaultArgumentComponent)
  266.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'datepicker', component: ? },
  267.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'daterangepicker', component: ? },
  268.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'smallString', component: ? },
  269.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'number', component: ? },
  270.    * ]}
  271.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.operators operators
  272.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.types types
  273.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.targets targets
  274.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.logicalTypes logicalTypes
  275.    * @param       {?Object} args.columns.argumentTypes argumentTypes
  276.    * @param       {Object} [args.options=core.defaults.options] options
  277.    * @return {Promise<core.PredicateCoreAPI, errors<*>>} resolved promise yield Predicate Core public API, rejected promise yield an error {@link errors}
  278.    * @memberof core
  279.    */
  280.   function PredicateCore(args) {
  281.     const { data, columns, ui, options } = args;
  283.     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
  284.       try {
  285.         dataclasses._requireProps(
  286.           columns,
  287.           'operators,logicalTypes,types,targets'
  288.         );
  289.       } catch (err) {
  290.         reject(err);
  291.         return;
  292.       }
  293.       resolve();
  294.     })
  295.       .then(() => _initializeColumns(columns))
  296.       .then(_columns => {
  297.         let _root;
  298.         let _api;
  299.         const _events = new EventEmitter();
  300.         const _options = merge(PredicateCore.defaults.options, options);
  302.         /**
  303.          * Loop through the predicate tree and update flags (e.g. $canBeRemoved)
  304.          * @return {undefined} nothing.
  305.          * @private
  306.          */
  307.         function _apply$flags() {
  308.           const canRemoveAnyPredicate = !rules.predicateToRemoveIsTheLastComparisonPredicate(
  309.             _root,
  310.             CompoundPredicate,
  311.             ComparisonPredicate
  312.           );
  314.           CompoundPredicate.forEach(_root, predicate => {
  315.             predicate.$canBeRemoved =
  316.               canRemoveAnyPredicate &&
  317.               !rules.predicateToRemoveIsRootPredicate(_root, predicate);
  318.           });
  319.         }
  321.         function _emitChangedEvent() {
  322.           _events.emit('changed', _api);
  323.         }
  325.         const _afterWrite = pipe(_apply$flags, _emitChangedEvent);
  327.         /**
  328.          * Set PredicateCore data
  329.          * @param {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} root CompoundPredicate
  330.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate>} resolved promise yield nothing, rejected promise yield RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate error
  331.          * @since 1.0.0
  332.          * @memberof core.api
  333.          */
  334.         function setData(root) {
  335.           return invariants
  336.             .RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate(root, CompoundPredicate)
  337.             .then(() => {
  338.               _root = root;
  339.             });
  340.         }
  342.         /**
  343.          * @param {object} json user defined JSON
  344.          * @return {Promise<Predicate, errors<*>>} resolved promise yield the root CompoundPredicate, rejected promise yield an errors
  345.          */
  346.         function _fromJSON(json) {
  347.           return Predicate.fromJSON(json, {
  348.             getTargetById: target_id =>
  349.               _getTargetById(_columns.targets, target_id),
  350.             getLogicalTypeById: logicalType_id =>
  351.               _getLogicalTypeById(_columns.logicalTypes, logicalType_id),
  352.             getOperatorById: operator_id =>
  353.               _getOperatorById(_columns.operators, operator_id),
  354.           });
  355.         }
  357.         /**
  358.          * Add a ComparisonPredicate or CompoundPredicate
  359.          * @param  {Object} option option object
  360.          * @param  {string} options.type what type of Predicate to add
  361.          * @param  {string} [options.how=after] should we insert it before, after or instead of? (currently only after is supported)
  362.          * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate} options.where current element
  363.          * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Predicate>} inserted predicate
  364.          * @since 1.0.0
  365.          * @memberof core.api
  366.          */
  367.         function add({ where, how = 'after', type }) {
  368.           // currently only after is supported
  369.           return (
  370.             Promise.resolve()
  371.               .then(() => invariants.AddOnlySupportsAfter(how))
  372.               .then(() =>
  373.                 invariants.PredicateTypeMustBeValid(type, Predicate.Types)
  374.               )
  375.               // generate the Predicates
  376.               .then(() => _options[`getDefault${type}`](_columns, _options))
  377.               // then add it
  378.               .then(predicate => {
  379.                 const isComparisonPredicate = ComparisonPredicate.is(where);
  381.                 if (isComparisonPredicate || CompoundPredicate.is(where)) {
  382.                   if (isComparisonPredicate) {
  383.                     // it's a comparisonpredicate
  384.                     // first find predicates array that contains the element
  385.                     const path = _find(where);
  386.                     // we are starting from a ComparisonPredicate that always live inside a CompoundPredicate.predicates array
  387.                     const [compoundpredicate, [_, index]] = takeLast(2, path);
  388.                     compoundpredicate.predicates = insert(
  389.                       index + 1,
  390.                       predicate,
  391.                       compoundpredicate.predicates
  392.                     );
  393.                   } else {
  394.                     // it's a compoundpredicate
  395.                     // we want to add a CompoundPredicate after a compound predicate
  396.                     // so we need to add it as its first .predicates entry
  397.                     where.predicates.unshift(predicate);
  398.                   }
  400.                   return predicate;
  401.                 }
  403.                 return Promise.reject(
  404.                   new errors.CannotAddSomethingElseThanACompoundPredicateOrAComparisonPredicate()
  405.                 );
  406.               })
  407.           );
  408.         }
  410.         /**
  411.          * Remove a ComparisonPredicate or CompoundPredicate
  412.          * @param  {(dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate|dataclasses.CompoundPredicate)} predicate predicate
  413.          * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Predicate>} yield the removed predicate, will reject the promise if remove was called with the root CompoundPredicate or the last ComparisonPredicate of the root CompoundPredicate
  414.          * @since 1.0.0
  415.          * @memberof core.api
  416.          */
  417.         function remove(predicate) {
  418.           return Promise.resolve()
  419.             .then(() =>
  420.               invariants.RemovePredicateMustDifferFromRootPredicate(
  421.                 _root,
  422.                 predicate
  423.               )
  424.             )
  425.             .then(() =>
  426.               invariants.RemovePredicateCannotBeTheLastComparisonPredicate(
  427.                 _root,
  428.                 predicate,
  429.                 CompoundPredicate,
  430.                 ComparisonPredicate
  431.               )
  432.             )
  433.             .then(() => {
  434.               if (
  435.                 CompoundPredicate.is(predicate) ||
  436.                 ComparisonPredicate.is(predicate)
  437.               ) {
  438.                 const path = _find(predicate);
  439.                 // we are starting from a ComparisonPredicate that always live
  440.                 // inside a CompoundPredicate.predicates array
  441.                 const [parentCompoundpredicate, [_, index]] = takeLast(2, path);
  442.                 parentCompoundpredicate.predicates.splice(index, 1);
  444.                 if (parentCompoundpredicate.predicates.length === 0) {
  445.                   // if there are not any more predicates
  446.                   // inside the parentCompoundpredicate, we should also remove it
  447.                   return remove(parentCompoundpredicate);
  448.                 }
  450.                 return predicate;
  451.               }
  453.               return Promise.reject(
  454.                 new errors.CannotRemoveSomethingElseThanACompoundPredicateOrAComparisonPredicate()
  455.               );
  456.             });
  457.         }
  459.         /**
  460.          * Change a CompoundPredicate logical
  461.          * @param {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} predicate predicate
  462.          * @param {string} newLogicalType_id newLogicalType_id
  463.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate error
  464.          * @since 1.0.0
  465.          * @memberof core.api
  466.          */
  467.         function setPredicateLogicalType_id(predicate, newLogicalType_id) {
  468.           return invariants
  469.             .PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate(predicate, CompoundPredicate)
  470.             .then(() => {
  471.               // first change the logical type
  472.               return _getLogicalTypeById(
  473.                 _columns.logicalTypes,
  474.                 newLogicalType_id
  475.               );
  476.             })
  477.             .then(logicalType => {
  478.               predicate.logic = logicalType;
  479.             });
  480.         }
  482.         /**
  483.          * Change a predicate's target
  484.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate predicate
  485.          * @param {string} newTarget_id newTarget_id
  486.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate error
  487.          * @since 1.0.0
  488.          * @memberof core.api
  489.          */
  490.         function setPredicateTarget_id(predicate, newTarget_id) {
  491.           return (
  492.             invariants
  493.               .PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate(
  494.                 predicate,
  495.                 ComparisonPredicate
  496.               )
  497.               // first change the target
  498.               .then(() => _getTargetById(_columns.targets, newTarget_id))
  499.               .then(target => {
  500.                 predicate.target = target;
  502.                 // then change the operator to the first operator for this target
  503.                 return setPredicateOperator_id(
  504.                   predicate,
  505.                   head(predicate.target.$type.$operators).operator_id
  506.                 );
  507.               })
  508.           );
  509.         }
  511.         /**
  512.          * Change a predicate's operator
  513.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate predicate
  514.          * @param {string} newOperator_id newOperator_id
  515.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate error
  516.          * @since 1.0.0
  517.          * @memberof core.api
  518.          */
  519.         function setPredicateOperator_id(predicate, newOperator_id) {
  520.           return (
  521.             Promise.resolve()
  522.               // find operator
  523.               .then(() =>
  524.                 invariants.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator(
  525.                   predicate.target.$type.$operators.find(
  526.                     operator => operator.operator_id === newOperator_id
  527.                   )
  528.                 )
  529.               )
  531.               // change the operator
  532.               .then(operator => {
  533.                 predicate.operator = operator;
  535.                 // then reset arguments
  536.                 predicate.argument = null;
  537.               })
  538.           );
  539.         }
  541.         /**
  542.          * Change a predicate's operator value
  543.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate predicate
  544.          * @param {*} newValue newValue
  545.          * @return {Promise<undefined>} yield nothing if everything went right, currently everything always go right ;)
  546.          * @since 1.0.0
  547.          * @memberof core.api
  548.          */
  549.         function setArgumentValue(predicate, newValue) {
  550.           return Promise.resolve().then(() => {
  551.             predicate.argument = newValue;
  552.           });
  553.         }
  555.         /**
  556.          * Get a UI Component (e.g. Vue Component) based on the argumentType_id
  557.          * @param {string} argumentType_id the argumentType id to find
  558.          * @return {*} it will either yield the argumentType id associated component or fallback on {@link core.defaults.getArgumentTypeComponentById} to yield the default component
  559.          * @since 1.0.0
  560.          * @memberof core.api
  561.          */
  562.         function getArgumentTypeComponentById(argumentType_id) {
  563.           return option
  564.             .fromNullable(
  565.               _columns.argumentTypes.find(
  566.                 argumentType => argumentType.argumentType_id === argumentType_id
  567.               )
  568.             )
  569.             .map(argumentType => argumentType.component)
  570.             .valueOrElse(() =>
  571.               _options.getDefaultArgumentComponent(_columns, _options)
  572.             );
  573.         }
  575.         /**
  576.          * Get default or overrided ui component
  577.          * @param {ui} name the UIType key to get the right component
  578.          * @return {any} component
  579.          * @since 1.0.0
  580.          * @memberof core.api
  581.          */
  582.         function getUIComponent(name) {
  583.           return ui[name];
  584.         }
  586.         /**
  587.          * Compute the JSON pointer path the element
  588.          * @param  {Object} element (http://jsonpatch.com/)
  589.          * @return {?Array} null if not found
  590.          * @readonly
  591.          * @since 1.0.0
  592.          */
  593.         function _find(element) {
  594.           return CompoundPredicate.reduce(
  595.             _root,
  596.             (acc, predicate, parents) => {
  597.               return element === predicate ? parents : acc;
  598.             },
  599.             null
  600.           );
  601.         }
  603.         /**
  604.          * Yield a serializable object without internal flags ($xxx properties)
  605.          * @example console.log(JSON.stringify(ctrl, null, 2)); // will call ctrl.toJSON() underneath
  606.          * @return {Object} a serializable object
  607.          * @since 1.0.0
  608.          * @memberof core.api
  609.          */
  610.         function toJSON() {
  611.           return Predicate.toJSON(_root);
  612.         }
  614.         /**
  615.          * Adds the `listener` function to the end of the listeners array for the event named `eventName`.
  616.          * No checks are made to see if the `listener` has already been added. Multiple calls passing the same combination of eventName and listener will result in the listener being added, and called, multiple times.
  617.          * @param  {string} eventName available event names are : (`changed`, api)
  618.          * @param  {function} listener listener
  619.          * @return {undefined}
  620.          * @since 1.0.0
  621.          * @memberof core.api
  622.          */
  623.         function on(eventName, listener) {
  624.           _events.on(eventName, listener);
  625.         }
  627.         /**
  628.          * Adds a *one-time* `listener` function for the event named `eventName`. The next time `eventName` is triggered, this `listener` is removed and then invoked.
  629.          * @param  {string} eventName see {@link core.api.on} for available event names
  630.          * @param  {function} listener listener
  631.          * @return {undefined}
  632.          * @see core.api.on
  633.          * @since 1.0.0
  634.          * @memberof core.api
  635.          */
  636.         function once(eventName, listener) {
  637.           _events.once(eventName, listener);
  638.         }
  640.         /**
  641.          * Remove listener(s)
  642.          * If off() will remove every listeners
  643.          * If off(eventName) will only remove listeners to this specific eventName
  644.          * If off(eventName, listener) will remove the `listener` to the `eventName`
  645.          * @param  {?string} eventName see {@link core.api.on} for available event names
  646.          * @param  {?function} listener listener
  647.          * @return {undefined}
  648.          * @since 1.0.0
  649.          * @memberof core.api
  650.          */
  651.         function off(eventName, listener) {
  652.           if (!eventName) {
  653.             // because removeAllListeners treat "undefined" as an event name :facepalm:
  654.             _events.removeAllListeners();
  655.           } else if (!listener) {
  656.             _events.removeAllListeners(eventName);
  657.           } else {
  658.             _events.removeListener(eventName, listener);
  659.           }
  660.         }
  662.         // get data for initialization
  663.         return (
  664.           (data ? _fromJSON(data) : _options.getDefaultData(_columns, _options))
  665.             // setup PredicateCore data
  666.             .then(_afterPromise(setData, _afterWrite))
  667.             // expose public API
  668.             .then(() => {
  669.               /**
  670.                * ui-predicate core public API
  671.                * @typedef {object} PredicateCoreAPI
  672.                * @namespace core.api
  673.                */
  674.               _api = {
  675.                 on,
  676.                 once,
  677.                 off,
  679.                 setData: _afterPromise(setData, _afterWrite),
  680.                 add: _afterPromise(add, _afterWrite),
  681.                 remove: _afterPromise(remove, _afterWrite),
  682.                 setPredicateTarget_id: _afterPromise(
  683.                   setPredicateTarget_id,
  684.                   _afterWrite
  685.                 ),
  686.                 setPredicateOperator_id: _afterPromise(
  687.                   setPredicateOperator_id,
  688.                   _afterWrite
  689.                 ),
  690.                 setPredicateLogicalType_id: _afterPromise(
  691.                   setPredicateLogicalType_id,
  692.                   _afterWrite
  693.                 ),
  694.                 setArgumentValue: _afterPromise(setArgumentValue, _afterWrite),
  696.                 getArgumentTypeComponentById,
  698.                 /**
  699.                  * Enumeration of overridable core ui-predicate component
  700.                  * @enum {String}
  701.                  */
  702.                 UITypes,
  704.                 /**
  705.                  * Get core UI component (e.g. target selector)
  706.                  * @param {core.ui} ui component name
  707.                  * @return {Object} component
  708.                  * @memberof core.api
  709.                  */
  710.                 getUIComponent,
  711.                 toJSON,
  713.                 /**
  714.                  * Get root CompoundPredicate
  715.                  * @return {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} root CompoundPredicate
  716.                  * @memberof core.api
  717.                  */
  718.                 get root() {
  719.                   return _root;
  720.                 },
  722.                 // used for testing
  723.                 get columns() {
  724.                   return _columns;
  725.                 },
  727.                 // used for testing
  728.                 get options() {
  729.                   return _options;
  730.                 },
  731.               };
  733.               return _api;
  734.             })
  735.         );
  736.       });
  737.   }
  739.   /**
  740.    * Defaults configuration of PredicateCore
  741.    * @type {Object}
  742.    * @namespace core.defaults
  743.    */
  744.   PredicateCore.defaults = {
  745.     /**
  746.      * Defaults options of PredicateCore
  747.      * @type {Object}
  748.      * @namespace core.defaults.options
  749.      */
  750.     options: {
  751.       /**
  752.        * When data is not set at construction time PredicateCore default behavior will be to use the first target and its first operator with empty argument
  753.        * @param  {Object} columns every necessary data class
  754.        * @param  {Object} options PredicateCore available options
  755.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>}  root CompoundPredicate
  756.        * @since 1.0.0
  757.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  758.        */
  759.       getDefaultData(columns, options) {
  760.         return options
  761.           .getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options)
  762.           .then(comparisonPredicate => {
  763.             return options.getDefaultCompoundPredicate(columns, options, [
  764.               comparisonPredicate,
  765.             ]);
  766.           });
  767.       },
  769.       /**
  770.        * Default compount predicate to use
  771.        *
  772.        * This function is called whenever a new CompoundPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  773.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  774.        * @param  {Object} options PredicateCore available options
  775.        * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates array of predicates to include into the CompoundPredicate
  776.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>} a CompoundPredicate
  777.        * @since 1.0.0
  778.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  779.        */
  780.       getDefaultCompoundPredicate(columns, options, predicates) {
  781.         return (!Array.isArray(predicates) || predicates.length === 0
  782.           ? options
  783.               .getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options)
  784.               .then(comparisonPredicate => [comparisonPredicate])
  785.           : Promise.resolve(predicates)
  786.         ).then(predicates =>
  787.           options
  788.             .getDefaultLogicalType(predicates, columns, options)
  789.             .then(logicalType => CompoundPredicate(logicalType, predicates))
  790.         );
  791.       },
  793.       /**
  794.        * Default comparison predicate to use
  795.        *
  796.        * This function is called whenever a new ComparisonPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  797.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  798.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  799.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate>} a Comparison
  800.        * @since 1.0.0
  801.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  802.        */
  803.       getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options) {
  804.         const firstTarget = head(columns.targets);
  805.         return ComparisonPredicate(
  806.           firstTarget,
  807.           head(firstTarget.$type.$operators)
  808.         );
  809.       },
  811.       /**
  812.        * Default logical type to use when a new comparison predicate is created
  813.        *
  814.        * This function is called whenever a new ComparisonPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  815.        * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates specified columns
  816.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  817.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  818.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.LogicalType>} a logical type
  819.        * @since 1.0.0
  820.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  821.        */
  822.       getDefaultLogicalType(predicates, columns, options) {
  823.         return Promise.resolve(head(columns.logicalTypes));
  824.       },
  826.       /**
  827.        * Get the default UI component for any argument. Also used if no registered UI component match `argumentType_id`
  828.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  829.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  830.        * @return {*} yield a UI Component (depending on the UI Framework used)
  831.        * @throws if the UI Framework adapter did not override this function. Each UI Framework adapter (e.g. ui-predicate-vue, ui-predicate-react, ...) must implement this and let user override it
  832.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  833.        */
  834.       getDefaultArgumentComponent(columns, options) {
  835.         throw new errors.UIFrameworkMustImplementgetDefaultArgumentComponent(
  836.           'UIFrameworkMustImplementgetDefaultArgumentComponent'
  837.         );
  838.       },
  839.     },
  840.   };
  842.   return PredicateCore;
  843. };
Documentation generated by JSDoc 3.5.5 using the docdash theme.
